item.title: Coronavirus: UK to open up European holidays from 6 July
item.description: People returning from certain destinations will not have to quarantine, the government confirms.

item.title: Officer stabbed in Glasgow hotel attack named
item.description: PC David Whyte was seriously injured dealing with a multiple stabbing before a suspect was killed.

item.title: Liverpool: Crowds celebrating title win despite coronavirus fears 'told to leave'
item.description: Police issue a dispersal order after crowds gather for a second night despite coronavirus fears.

item.title: Coronavirus: More care urged for pregnant BAME patients
item.description: Maternity units in England are being asked to provide more checks and support during the pandemic.

item.title: Simpsons ends use of white actors to voice people of colour
item.description: The decision by the US comedy show follows years of criticism over a white actor playing an Indian.

item.title: Trump orders statues be protected from 'mob rule'
item.description: "Anarchists" who damage US monuments should face up to a decade in prison, the president says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Armed forces praised for 'versatility' in pandemic
item.description: Tributes are paid to veterans and serving military personnel as the nation marks Armed Forces Day.

item.title: Facebook to tag harmful posts as boycott widens
item.description: The firm has been under pressure to improve its moderation of the content on its platform.

item.title: Coronavirus: US has 'serious problem', says Fauci
item.description: The infection is rampant in 16 states, some of which are now freezing their reopening plans.

item.title: Justin Bieber files defamation lawsuit after assault claims
item.description: Two anonymous Twitter accounts made sexual assault allegations against the singer last week.

item.title: Philonise Floyd: 'It's just a lot of pain right now'
item.description: The brother of George Floyd and the family's lawyer spoke to the BBC about the impact his death has had on the world.

item.title: UK weather: Hailstones fall on Leeds and Sheffield
item.description: A Met Office yellow weather warning for thunderstorms and heavy rain remains in place.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Green light for hols' as PM warns rule flouters
item.description: Saturday's front pages look at how travelling abroad could work this summer.

item.title: Poles in UK fear Brexit and Covid may end 'British Dream' hopes
item.description: Should I stay or should I go is the top question for many Polish people in the UK, says one charity.

item.title: From coronavirus doctor to Mr Gay World
item.description: Fran Alvarado from Spain took over the title weeks after recovering from Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: The health claims that won't go away
item.description: Why this misleading health advice keeps appearing online.

item.title: Fortnite Movie Nite: Christopher Nolan's hit films screen in-game
item.description: Christopher Nolan's movies play inside Fortnite while his latest film is delayed again.

item.title: How Facebook scammers target people at risk of suicide
item.description: Dozens of Facebook pages claim to be selling a deadly chemical to people at risk of suicide - but it's all a fraud.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Why can't some businesses reopen in England yet?
item.description: Changes to England's lockdown have sparked questions over what opens and what must stay shut.

item.title: Can Kenzie Ziegler go from child star to pop star?
item.description: She shot to fame as a six-year-old on US reality show Dance Moms, now she's aiming for the charts.

item.title: We had a lockdown choice - care for Amy or never see her
item.description: Parents describe the exhaustion of caring for an adult daughter with learning disabilities in the lockdown.

item.title: Viewpoint: 'I feel like was accidentally hired'
item.description: Ibrahim Diallo describes what life as a black software engineer has been like for him.

item.title: Why Huawei's days in the UK could be numbered
item.description: US sanctions threaten access to chip design software, which could determine its fate in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: 5G and microchip conspiracies around the world
item.description: We've been tracking the global spread of two of the most popular coronavirus conspiracy theories.

item.title: 'We want to perform for manager, club & city' - Liverpool's title-winning captain Henderson
item.description: Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson discusses winning the Premier League, working with Jurgen Klopp and what the future holds for the club.

item.title: Mikel Arteta: Arsenal manager only wants players 'on the boat'
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says he only wants players ready to jump "on the boat" after speculation about midfielder Matteo Guendouzi's future.

item.title: Harder to win trophies at Man Utd now than it was under Ferguson - Solskjaer
item.description: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says it is harder to win trophies now than during the glory days under Sir Alex Ferguson.

item.title: Brentford boost promotion hopes with win over leaders West Brom
item.description: Ollie Watkins scores the only goal as Brentford beat leaders West Brom to hot up the Championship automatic promotion race.

item.title: Daniel Ricciardo focused on Renault after McLaren switch
item.description: Daniel Ricciardo says he and Renault have "moved on" from his decision to switch to McLaren next year ahead of the start of the new season.

item.title: Saturday's gossip: Man Utd interested in Arsenal midfielder Guendouzi
item.description: Man Utd's Guendouzi interest, Arsenal track Porto's Pereira, Maradona tries to lure Ronaldinho out of retirement, plus more.

item.title: Liverpool: Jurgen Klopp 'absolutely overwhelmed' by Premier League title win
item.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp tells BBC sports editor Dan Roan that he was "completely overwhelmed" when his side were confirmed as Premier League champions.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the chance of going on holiday?
item.description: Is it now possible to go on holiday, either in the UK or abroad?

item.title: Coronavirus: When will pubs, bars, cafes and restaurants reopen?
item.description: Pubs and restaurants in England will reopen in July, but can I meet a friend for a meal?

item.title: Coronavirus: Does anyone have a working contact-tracing app?
item.description: Is Boris Johnson right to say that no country has a working contact-tracing app?

item.title: Coronavirus: Has the NHS got enough PPE?
item.description: The government says it's working "around the clock" to provide protective equipment, but doctors say shortages put lives at risk.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What could local lockdowns look like in England?
item.description: Parts of the country could introduce them if cases of Covid-19 spike, but how might they work?

item.title: Container enthusiasm: How to grow lockdown veg in a tiny space
item.description: The lockdown gardening boom has become a phenomenon but how do you join if you don't have a garden?

item.title: Norfolk treasure-hunter puts finds down to 'beginner's luck'
item.description: Having unearthed two rare Anglo-Saxon treasures, Mel Hollwoger hopes for "something Celtic" next.

item.title: Warwick National Grid engineer named among 50 top women
item.description: Sena Mathobela Nleya says she wants to encourage more girls to become engineers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Shepreth Wildlife Park staff record life during lockdown
item.description: Staff at a small zoo in Cambridgeshire record their experiences of life at the site since lockdown.

item.title: Canal tow-path exercise: ‘I can’t socially distance’
item.description: Canal tow-path users have increased in number by more than 170% in Birmingham during the lockdown.
